subject: p17340686
Findings: Single AP supine portable view of the chest was obtained. A large bore left-sided central venous catheter is seen extending to the right atrium. There is moderate pulmonary edema with possible trace bilateral pleural effusions. Relative more confluent opacity in the right lung base is again seen, worrisome for consolidation which has been present over multiple prior radiographs and could relate to the pulmonary edema. The cardiac and mediastinal silhouettes are stable. Surgical clips seen in the upper abdomen.
